strictly larger than the norm of an element of norm `> 1`. For a version without an `R`, see
`riesz_lemma`.

(for instance no element of norm in `(1,2)`). Hence, we can not allow `R` arbitrarily close to `1`,
and require `R > â€–câ€–` for some `c : ğ•œ` with norm `> 1`.

      d â‰  0 âˆ§
        Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (Â«expr â€¢ Â» d x) < R âˆ§
          R / Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» c â‰¤ Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (Â«expr â€¢ Â» d x) âˆ§ (Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» d)â»Â¹ â‰¤ Râ»Â¹ * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» c * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» x :=

/-- Riesz's lemma, which usually states that it is possible to find a
vector with norm 1 whose distance to a closed proper subspace is
arbitrarily close to 1. The statement here is in terms of multiples of
norms, since in general the existence of an element of norm exactly 1
is not guaranteed. For a variant giving an element with norm in `[1, R]`, see
`riesz_lemma_of_norm_lt`. -/
theorem riesz_lemma {F : subspace ğ•œ E} (hFc : is_closed (F : set E)) (hF : âˆƒ x : E, x âˆ‰ F) {r : exprâ„} (hr : r < 1) :
    âˆƒ xâ‚€ : E, xâ‚€ âˆ‰ F âˆ§ âˆ€ y âˆˆ F, r * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» xâ‚€ â‰¤ Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (xâ‚€ - y) := by
  classical
    obtain âŸ¨x, hxâŸ© : âˆƒ x : E, x âˆ‰ F := hF
    let d := metric.inf_dist x F
    have hFn : (F : set E).nonempty := âŸ¨_, F.zero_memâŸ©
    have hdp : 0 < d := lt_of_le_of_ne metric.inf_dist_nonneg fun heq => hx ((hFc.mem_iff_inf_dist_zero hFn).2 HEq.symm)
    let r' := max r 2â»Â¹
    have hr' : r' < 1 := by
      simp [r', hr]
      norm_num
    have hlt : 0 < r' := lt_of_lt_of_le (by norm_num) (le_max_right r 2â»Â¹)
    have hdlt : d < d / r' := (lt_div_iff hlt).mpr ((mul_lt_iff_lt_one_right hdp).2 hr')
    obtain âŸ¨yâ‚€, hyâ‚€F, hxyâ‚€âŸ© : âˆƒ y âˆˆ F, dist x y < d / r' := (metric.inf_dist_lt_iff hFn).mp hdlt
    have x_ne_yâ‚€ : x - yâ‚€ âˆ‰ F := by
      by_contra h
      have : x - yâ‚€ + yâ‚€ âˆˆ F := F.add_mem h hyâ‚€F
      simp only [neg_add_cancel_right, sub_eq_add_neg] at this
      exact hx this
    refine' âŸ¨x - yâ‚€, x_ne_yâ‚€, fun y hy => le_of_lt _âŸ©
    have hyâ‚€y : yâ‚€ + y âˆˆ F := F.add_mem hyâ‚€F hy
    calc
      r * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (x - yâ‚€) â‰¤ r' * Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (x - yâ‚€) := mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right (le_max_left _ _) (norm_nonneg _)
      _ < d := by
        rw [â† dist_eq_norm]
        exact (lt_div_iff' hlt).1 hxyâ‚€
      _ â‰¤ dist x (yâ‚€ + y) := metric.inf_dist_le_dist_of_mem hyâ‚€y
      _ = Â«exprâ€– â€–Â» (x - yâ‚€ - y) := by rw [sub_sub, dist_eq_norm]
